meanings.definition: A set of three associated artistic, literary, or musical works intended to be appreciated together.
meanings.sent1: I love how the museum displayed the triptychs of the famous artist.
meanings.sent2: The gallery showcased beautiful triptychs by a talented painter.
meanings.sent3: The three books on my shelf formed a triptychs of mystery novels.
meanings.sent4: Her songs, like triptychs of emotions, touched the hearts of many.
meanings.sent5: The triptychs of colors in the painting created a mesmerizing effect.

meanings.definition: A hinged three-leaved tablet, written on both sides, used in ancient Rome for writing notes.
meanings.sent1: The archaeologist discovered an ancient triptychs with inscriptions from Rome.
meanings.sent2: In the museum, they had a display of Roman triptychs with Latin writings.
meanings.sent3: I wish I had a triptychs to jot down quick notes like the Romans did.
meanings.sent4: The triptychs of old messages revealed secrets of the past.
meanings.sent5: The triptychs of tablets were a common writing tool in ancient times.
